static get_private_key_from_seed(seed_bytes, path="m/44'/1137'/0'/0")[source]

Derive the private key from a seed entropy using derived path.

Parameters:

  • seed_bytes – The seed in bytes format.

  • path – The derivation path.

Returns:

The private key as a hexadecimal string.

Derive the public key from a private key using secp256k1.

Parameters:

private_key_hex – The private key in hexadecimal format.

Returns:

The public key as a hexadecimal string.

personal_sign(msg, private_key) → str[source]
static prepare_tx(amount: int, to_address: str, from_address: str, last_ref: LastReference, fee: int = 0) → Tuple[Transaction, str][source]

Prepare a new transaction.

Parameters:

  • amount – Amount to send.

  • to_address – Destination DAG address.

  • from_address – Source DAG address.

  • last_ref – Dictionary with keys: ordinal, hash.

  • fee – Transaction fee.

Returns:

TransactionV2 object, sha512hash, rle.

static sign(private_key_hex: str, tx_hash: str) → str[source]

Create transaction signature.

Parameters:

  • private_key_hex – Private key in hex format.

  • tx_hash – Transaction hash from prepare_tx.

Returns:

Signature supported by the transaction API (@noble/secp256k1).

static validate_address(address: str) → bool[source]

Returns True if DAG address is valid, False if invalid.

Parameters:

address – DAG address.

Returns:

Boolean value.

static validate_mnemonic(mnemonic_phrase: str) → bool[source]

Returns True is phrase is valid, False if invalid.

Parameters:

mnemonic_phrase – String of words (default: 12).

Returns:

Boolean value.

static verify(public_key_hex, tx_hash, signature_hex) → bool[source]

Verify is the signature is valid.

Parameters:

  • public_key_hex

  • tx_hash – Hex format

  • signature_hex

Returns:

True or False

pypergraph.dag_keystore.kryo module

class pypergraph.dag_keystore.kryo.Kryo[source]

Bases: object

serialize(msg: str, set_references: bool = True) → str[source]

Serialize a message using a custom kryo-like serialization method. Used after encoding the message to sign.

Parameters:

  • msg – The string message to serialize.

  • set_references – Whether to include references in the prefix.

Returns:

The serialized message as a hexadecimal string.
